intro: Androsace bulleyana, commonly known as the Bulley's rock sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in its rocky, alpine habitat. Androsace bulleyana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and scree slopes at high altitudes.
